Name: O Donnell Pappas syndrome
Synonyms_List__c: Foveal hypoplasia, congenital nystagmus, corneal pannus, and presenile cataracts, Foveal hypoplasia, presenile cataract
Disease_Description__c: Foveal hypoplasia is defined as the lack of foveal depression with continuity of all neurosensory retinal layers in the presumed foveal area. Foveal hypoplasia as an isolated entity is a rare phenomenon; it is usually described in association with other ocular disorders, such as aniridia (106210), microphthalmia (see 251600), albinism (see 203100), or achromatopsia (see 216900). All reported cases of foveal hypoplasia have been accompanied by decreased visual acuity and nystagmus (summary by Perez et al., 2014).Genetic Heterogeneity of Foveal HypoplasiaFoveal hypoplasia-2 (FVH2; 609218) is caused by mutation in the SLC38A8 gene (615585) on chromosome 16q23.
